thread.title: Kentucky, North Carolina share No. 1 in preseason men's basketball poll
thread.title_full: Kentucky, North Carolina share No. 1 in preseason men's basketball poll

title: Kentucky, North Carolina share No. 1 in preseason men's basketball poll
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Kentucky, North Carolina share No. 1 in preseason men's basketball poll For a third year in row, Kentucky is No. 1 in the preseason USA TODAY Sports men's basketball poll, but the Wildcats share the top spot with North Carolina. Maryland, Duke and Kansas round out the top five. Post to Facebook Kentucky, North Carolina share No. 1 in preseason men's basketball poll For a third year in row, Kentucky is No. 1 in the preseason USA TODAY Sports men's basketball poll, but the Wildcats share the top spot with North Carolina. Maryland, Duke and Kansas round out the top five.   USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/1RKhY33   14 To   Kentucky, North Carolina share No. 1 in preseason men's basketball poll Eddie Timanus , USA TODAY Sports 12:41 p.m. EDT October 15, 2015 Kentucky (Marcus Lee) and North Carolina (Marcus Paige) are tied at the top, sharing the preseason No. 1 ranking. (Photo: USA TODAY Sports) 425 CONNECT 105 TWEET LINKEDIN 14 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
For a third consecutive year, the Kentucky men’s basketball team enters the season with a No. 1 before its name. But this time, the Wildcats have company. 
Kentucky and North Carolina finished in a dead heat atop the coaches poll, a first in the preseason since USA TODAY began administering the poll in 1991. The Tar Heels have one more first-place vote — 12 to the Wildcats' 11 — but both teams wound up with a total of 749 poll points. It’s the first time since 2011 and fourth time overall that the Tar Heels are rated No. 1 by the coaches in the preseason poll. 
If the balloting is any indication of the action to come on the court, this figures to be one of the most wide-open campaigns for the ultimate prize in some time. TOP 25: USA TODAY Sports preseason coaches poll 
Five teams received at least one No. 1 vote, the most in a preseason poll since the 2004-05 season when there were eight. Maryland claimed five firsts and checks in at No. 3. Defending NCAA champion Duke will open at No. 4, picking up three No. 1’s. Rounding out the top five and claiming the remaining first-place nod is Kansas. Outlooks for each team in the preseason top 25 
In addition to the Tar Heels and Blue Devils, Virginia checks in at No. 6 to give the Atlantic Coast Conference three representatives in the top 10. The Big 12 also had three with No. 7 Iowa State and No. 8 Oklahoma joining the Jayhawks. 
Overall the Big 12 has five clubs in the top 25, sharing the lead with the Big Ten. The ACC has four altogether, and the Pac-12 and SEC have three each. The Big East has a pair, with single ranked squads from the West Coast (No. 11 Gonzaga), the Missouri Valley (No. 12 Wichita State) and American (co-No. 24 Connecticut). <!--iframe-->
